intro: Rhynchospora dolichostyla, commonly known as the long-styled marsh sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland habitats in North America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in marshes, swamps, and other moist environments, often forming dense stands. Its inflorescence consists of a single, elongated spike that bears small, spikelet-like flowers. Rhynchospora dolichostyla is characterized by its slender, triangular stems and its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor, waterlogged soils.
